175.article_body: The Sports Authority of India (SAI) has released ₹7.22 crore allowance to 2,509 Khelo India athletes across 21 disciplines, including para-sports, for the months of January to March. The amount includes an out-of-pocket allowance of ₹1.20 lakh for each residential athlete. The majority part of the budget is allocated for athletes' lodging, food and education at the academy, SAI said.

176.title: 40,000 tonnes of diesel from India reach Sri Lanka as it declares emergency
176.article_body: A ship carrying 40,000 tonnes of diesel under a $1-billion credit line by India has reached Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis. On Friday night, the country's government declared a state of emergency after protests over the crisis turned violent. Earlier, Indian Oil's Lankan subsidiary supplied 6,000 MT of fuel to the Ceylon Electricity Board to generate electricity.

177.title: Ukraine raises $600,000 from 'Museum of War' NFTs on Russian invasion
177.article_body: The Ukrainian government has raised more than $600,000 from its NFT collection, Meta History: Museum of War', showing a timeline of the Russian invasion. The government sold 1,282 artworks on its first day of sales, raising 190 Ether cryptocurrency tokens. The Ukrainian government has already raised about $70.2 million in crypto donations, its official website showed.

178.title: Woman techie arrested for selling cannabis to IT employees, youths in Hyd
178.article_body: A woman techie was arrested for allegedly supplying cannabis to some IT employees and youths in Hyderabad. Police said she, along with her husband and two others, were selling cannabis to customers on March 12 when police apprehended two youths with 1.2 kg cannabis. The couple, who had managed to escape, were arrested after police received information from the youths.

179.title: I suffered from sleep apnea, it got more intense with time and it is dangerous: Badshah
179.article_body: Rapper Badshah, in an episode of Shilpa Shetty's fitness chat show 'Shape of You', revealed that he suffered from sleep apnea. "It got more intense with time and it is dangerous," he added, stating that now he doesn't suffer from it. "I have been through clinical depression, I have been through severe anxiety disorder," he further said.

180.title: I don't discuss my orders: Zelenskyy on Russian allegations of fuel depot attack
180.article_body: Responding to Russian accusations that Ukraine attacked a fuel depot inside Russia's Belgorod, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "I'm sorry I don't discuss any of my orders." "There are things which I only share with military armed forces of Ukraine," Zelenskyy added. Russian Ministry of Defense stated that two Ukrainian Mi-24 helicopters carried out an airstrike on the depot.

181.title: SRH lodge protest against Kane Williamson's dismissal
181.article_body: SRH have lodged a protest with the BCCI against their captain Kane Williamson's dismissal against RR in their first IPL 2022 match, claiming that the catch was not clean. RR's Devdutt Padikkal had managed to scoop his fingers under the ball to hold onto a low catch and the third umpire had ruled that the catch was clean.

182.title: I need to work hard on my game: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav
182.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders' fast bowler Umesh Yadav believes that he needs to "work hard" on his skills despite picking up four wickets against the Punjab Kings on Friday. "I need to work hard. Getting older and when you know you play just one format, I look to bowl as much as possible," Yadav said.

183.title: Lemon price rises to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat due to tight supply
183.article_body: The prices of lemons have surged to ₹200 per kg in Gujarat's Rajkot due to a shortage in supplies and a rise in demand. Earlier, the lemons were being sold at ₹50-60 per kg, as per ANI report. "This increase in price is affecting our kitchen budget. We don't know when will the prices go down," a customer told ANI.

184.title: Russian forces are noticeably moving out of northern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
184.article_body: Russian troops are "slowly but noticeably" moving out of the north of Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. He urged residents to remain cautious amid troop withdrawal. Zelenskyy also warned that the situation in the country's east is "extremely difficult" with Russia gathering its forces and "preparing for new powerful blows". Ukraine is preparing an "active" defence, he added.

185.title: Exempt Ayodhya temples from water, house tax: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
185.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday asked Ayodhya Municipal Corporation to stop the collection of house and water taxes from temples, maths and dharamshalas. He instead suggested  taking 'token money' from such religious institutions. "He asked officials to prepare a plan in this regard and submit it to the urban development department," a government spokesperson added.

186.title: Too much pressure on Pollard, even the opponents know that: Shastri
186.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said there is "too much" pressure on MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard in the absence of Hardik Pandya, Krunal Pandya and Suryakumar Yadav. "Even the opponents know that Pollard is under pressure. His early wicket can make a difference of 20-30 runs," added Shastri. Pollard was dismissed for three in MI's IPL 2022 opener against DC.

187.title: Police seize truck carrying 197 kg of marijuana in Pune, 3 booked
187.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad police have seized 197 kilograms of marijuana from a truck in Pune and have booked three people including the driver who has been arrested. Police intercepted the truck on the Chakan–Shikrapur road and seized items worth ₹63.34 lakh, police said. The case was lodged under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

188.title: Hyd SHE Teams in-charge reviews performance for first quarter of 2022
188.article_body: AR Srinivas, Additional Commissioner of Police (Crimes), on Friday reviewed the performance of Hyderabad SHE Teams for the first quarter of the year 2022. Srinivas, who is also in-charge of SHE Teams, rewarded officials for their sustained efforts in making Hyderabad a safe city for women. He further promised to provide the teams with more advanced logistics in future.

189.title: Pune court to fine woman each time father is denied access to son
189.article_body: A family court in Pune has directed a woman to allow the father access to their 11-year-old son or she will be fined ₹5,000 for each missed access. The court said that if the woman violates the order in the next six months, the son's custody will be given to the father. The couple has been living separately since 2008.

190.title: Punjab govt is 'baccha party': Anil Vij on Punjab seeking transfer of Chandigarh
190.article_body: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana Minister Anil Vij, said, "Punjab government is 'baccha party'. They don't have complete knowledge of issues." "Chandigarh isn't the only issue but there are many other issues linked to it," he added. "They didn't speak anything about issues like SYL, Hindi speaking areas," he added.

191.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 10 accused, rejects pleas of 8 in Palghar lynching case
191.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to 10 accused and rejected the pleas of eight others in connection with 2020 Palghar mob lynching case. The applicants cannot be held guilty without any sufficient evidence, HC said. A mob lynched two sadhus and their driver in April 2020 in Maharashtra's Palghar amid rumours that thieves were roaming around during COVID-19 lockdown.

192.title: Trust yourself when no one does: Amit Mishra on Umesh holding Purple Cap
192.article_body: Reacting to Umesh Yadav being IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "Trust yourself even when no one else does." Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches at an economy rate of 4.91. "Umesh played...two matches in [the] last two IPL seasons...Warms my heart to see him do well," read a tweet from Wasim Jaffer.

193.title: Teacher gets 5-year jail term for sexually abusing 13-year-old boy in Mumbai
193.article_body: A 52-year-old sports teacher was convicted and sentenced to five years in jail for sexually abusing a 13-year-old boy on the pretext of giving him a medal and a certificate for participating in a competition. The boy informed a court in Mumbai that the accused pretended to show him and his friend a magic trick and then touched him inappropriately.

194.title: BMC's property tax collection increases by ₹700 crore in 2021-22
194.article_body: The property tax collected by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) increased by ₹700 crore in 2021-22 as compared to the last year. The BMC collected ₹5,792 crore from property tax in 2021-22, which is the highest in its history, officials added. According to the civic body, three out of the city's 24 wards collected 30% more tax than the previous year.

195.title: Langur cutouts to be placed in parts of UP's Meerut to scare away monkeys
195.article_body: The Forest Department in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has decided to place cutouts of langurs in some areas to scare away monkeys. "Increasing monkey presence is a concern in northern India," Meerut DFO said, adding that the move is aimed at providing relief to people. Residents had earlier reportedly appealed to the district administration to find a solution to the problem.

196.title: Biden nominates 2 Indian-Americans to key administrative positions
196.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated two Indian-Americans to key administrative positions. Vinay Singh has been nominated as Chief Financial Officer, Department of Housing and Urban Development, while Kalpana Kotagal is the nominee for Commissioner on the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission. Singh had also served in the Obama-Biden administration as a Deputy Assistant Secretary (US Field).

197.title: Class 10 girl beaten for hours for filing rape complaint in Odisha
197.article_body: Eight people, including five women, have been arrested for allegedly beating a Class 10 girl for hours at a kangaroo court in Odisha's Nayagarh for filing a case accusing a 21-year-old man of raping her. The girl's family claimed that they were advised to not file a case earlier. The girl was also tied to an electric pole, police said.

198.title: My PAN card misused, small loan of ₹2,500 taken on my name: Rajkummar Rao calls out fraud
198.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao took to Twitter to call out fraud, claiming that his PAN card was misused and a small loan of ₹2,500 was taken on his name. He added that his CIBIL score has been affected due to it. He further wrote, "@CIBIL_Official, please rectify the same and do take precautionary steps against this."

199.title: Irfan Pathan pranks Suresh Raina on live TV over Preity Zinta comment
199.article_body: Irfan Pathan pranked Suresh Raina on April Fool's Day during pre-IPL match show. Irfan was talking about PBKS when Raina remarked, "Irfan...played for PBKS...for three years...Preity Zinta is their owner." Seemingly angry, Irfan said, "This isn't right...The way you brought in female angle" and left the frame. Irfan revealed it was a prank when Raina went to bring him back.

200.title: BharatPe has appointed Alvarez & Marsal exec as interim CFO: Chairman
200.article_body: BharatPe has appointed an executive from Alvarez & Marsal as its interim CFO, Chairman Rajnish Kumar said. The firm is in search of a permanent CFO and Kumar said it is in the "advanced stages" to appoint one. Kumar added that the board, founders, and management are exploring taking the firm public in the next 18-24 months.

201.title: Twitter tweets 'we're working on an edit button'; users say it's April Fools' Day
201.article_body: On April 1, Twitter tweeted on its official account that it was "working on an edit button" after which several users flagged that it was April Fools' Day. When asked if the tweet was a joke, Twitter told Reuters, "We cannot confirm or deny but we may edit our statement later." "Prove it by editing this tweet," a user wrote.

202.title: 'Stop bullying India' poster found outside US Embassy in Delhi; FIR registered
202.article_body: Delhi Police have registered an FIR against an unknown person after a poster asking US to "stop bullying India" was found stuck on a board outside the US Embassy. "Reliable [US President] Biden administration, stop bullying India. We don't need you. US needs India against China," the poster read. Police is making use of technical surveillance to trace the person.

203.title: Chandigarh is and will remain joint capital of Punjab, Haryana: CM Khattar
203.article_body: After Punjab government's resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said Chandigarh is the joint capital of the two states and will remain so. "Punjab government's one-sided resolution has no meaning," he added. "This isn't only a subject of Punjab but also of Haryana. Even the people of Himachal Pradesh claim their share," Khattar said.

204.title: 3 arrested for shooting at sarpanch over business rivalry in Gurugram
204.article_body: Three men were arrested for their alleged involvement in the shooting of a 50-year-old sarpanch in Gurugram's Babupur over business rivalry, police said. The main accused had taken a loan of ₹10 lakh from the sarpanch's nephew, police added. On being asked to return the loan, the accused demanded a share in the nephew's water supply and construction business.

205.title: 'Pulp Fiction' stars Samuel, Uma Thurman to reunite for 'The Kill Room'
205.article_body: Samuel L. Jackson and Uma Thurman, who shared screen space in 'Pulp Fiction', are teaming up again for a new comic crime thriller titled 'The Kill Room'. According to The Hollywood Reporter, it'll be directed by Nicol Paone, who helmed the comedy-drama 'Friendsgiving'. "Getting to make 'The Kill Room' with Uma and Samuel is beyond my wildest dreams," Paone said.

206.title: Performance of Lalit, Axar has given DC a huge boost: Ajit Agarkar
206.article_body: Delhi Capitals' assistant coach Ajit Agarkar has acknowledged that their IPL franchise got a "huge boost" from Lalit Yadav and Axar Patel's match-winning partnership against Mumbai Indians last week. "When you win from difficult situations, it always gives you... much more confidence as a team," Agarkar said. He also added that DC have a great depth in its batting order.

207.title: China denies deliberately circumventing Russia sanctions
207.article_body: China said it's not deliberately circumventing sanctions on Russia, a day after EU leaders warned Beijing against doing so. Wang Lutong, a Chinese Foreign Ministry official, said Beijing was helping the global economy through continued trade with Russia. "China is not a related party to Ukraine crisis. We don't think our normal trade with any...country should be affected," Lutong said.

208.title: BJP MP demands renaming UP's Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar, writes to CM
208.article_body: BJP MP from Farrukhabad, Mukesh Rajput, has written to UP CM Yogi Adityanath demanding renaming Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar. “Farrukhabad has links to the Mahabharata era. The capital of king Drupada used to be here... known as Panchala area,” he wrote. However, Rajput denied the request being based on religious lines and claimed it's to only "revive ancient Indian culture".

209.title: Uber raises cab fares by 15% in Mumbai as fuel prices go up
209.article_body: App-based taxi firm Uber has raised fares by 15% for travel in Mumbai to offset the impact of rising fuel prices, the company said. Fuel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days across the country on Saturday. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre while diesel price has increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.

210.title: Matua community pilgrims claim their bus attacked in Bengal, block rail track
210.article_body: Some members of the Matua community blocked the track at Habra railway station in protest against an alleged attack on a bus carrying the pilgrims to 'Baruni Mela' in West Bengal. Four persons have been arrested in the incident so far. Police claimed the pilgrims got into an altercation with another bus' passengers following a collision between the two vehicles.

211.title: IIT-Delhi gifted indoor sports complex by alumnus Saurabh Mittal
211.article_body: IIT-Delhi inaugurated its three-storey air-conditioned indoor sports complex on Friday. The complex will be called the ‘Mittal Sports Complex’ since it has been installed due to the financial aid of ₹10 crore given by the institute's alumnus and co-founder of the Indiabulls group Saurabh Mittal. The complex has several facilities including badminton courts, squash courts and a conference room.

212.title: Microsoft hires ex-Seattle police chief as global security risk ops exec
212.article_body: Microsoft has hired former Seattle police chief Carmen Best as Director of global security risk operations. Best became the first Black woman to serve as chief in 2018 but left in 2020. She will be in charge of Microsoft's global virtual security operations team, intelligence, executive threat intel, special asset security and event security, among other things.

213.title: UP Police raids BSP leader Haji Yakoob Qureshi's meat factory in Meerut
213.article_body: UP Police raided a meat factory in Meerut owned by BSP leader and former minister, Haji Yakoob Qureshi, officials said. "A case has been registered against 14 people...10 of them have been arrested. We found that it was running illegally," Meerut SSP Prabhakar Chaudhary said. "Action will be taken against the culprits under the Gangster Act," he added.

214.title: Neighbours allegedly beat Muslim man for putting up BJP flag in UP
214.article_body: A case has been filed after a Muslim man from Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur alleged that his neighbours thrashed him for putting up a BJP flag at his house. The man claimed that his neighbours were angered after a BJP MLA had come there and garlanded him. Earlier, a Muslim man was allegedly killed for celebrating BJP's win in state polls.

215.title: 3 criminals killed in police encounter in Assam's Goalpara
215.article_body: Three criminals were allegedly killed in police encounter while trying to escape in a truck in Assam's Goalpara district on Friday. "Acting on a tip-off, we stopped a vehicle but they tried to run away and opened fire on us," ASP Mrinal Deka said. The criminals were badly injured in the incident and were declared dead at hospital, he added.

216.title: No fine to be imposed for not wearing face masks in Delhi
216.article_body: In view of the declining COVID-19 positivity rate, the Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) announced on Friday that the fine imposed for not wearing masks in public places will now be scrapped. An order issued by the DDMA, however, advised people to continue wearing masks in public places in order to avoid contracting COVID-19.

217.title: Doctors wanted to amputate my leg after I smashed my knee during 'Force 2': John
217.article_body: Actor John Abraham has revealed that doctors wanted to amputate his leg after he smashed his knee during 'Force 2'. "I underwent three surgeries. I had gangrene in my right leg and the doctors wanted to amputate my leg," he said. He added that his surgeon Dr Rajesh Maniar from Mumbai saved his knee.

218.title: 3 journalists among 34 arrested over Uttar Pradesh Board question paper leak
218.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police on Friday arrested 10 more people, including three journalists and parents and guardians of students, in connection with the leak of Class 12 UP Board English paper in Ballia. So far, 34 persons have been arrested in the case. At least two of the journalists have alleged that they've been framed for reporting on the paper leak.

219.title: Umesh was among the last to get picked, now most effective: Ajay Jadeja
219.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder Umesh Yadav was among the last players to get picked in mega auction, but is now the most effective. "Many players in the IPL end up getting typecast," added Ajay. Umesh has picked eight wickets in three matches so far, after recording figures of 4/23 against PBKS.

220.title: Anyone can be a mystery bowler by bowling the perfect length: Rashid
220.article_body: GT spinner Rashid Khan said anyone can become a mystery bowler by bowling the deliveries at the perfect length time and again. "If you have good control over your skills, the element of mystery doesn't matter," added Rashid. "My length...makes me different from other leg-spinners," stated Rashid. "I am a spin-fast bowler because of [my] pace," said Rashid.

221.title: PM Modi greets people on Hindu New Year, Chaitra Navaratri
221.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday greeted people on the beginning of Hindu New Year, Chaitra Navaratri, and offered his best wishes to various regions and communities celebrating their new year as per the traditional Hindu calendar. "Happy New Year to all of you. May Vikram Samvat 2079 bring new enthusiasm and new zeal in everyone’s life," PM Modi tweeted.

222.title: India & Australia sign trade pact, 96% Indian goods to get duty free access
222.article_body: India and Australia on Saturday signed the Economic Cooperation & Trade Agreement to boost economic ties. Under the pact, over 96% Indian goods will get duty free access to Australia's market. "This is truly a watershed moment," PM Narendra Modi said. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said the agreement will take bilateral trade to $45-50 billion in the next five years.

223.title: Rishi Kapoor was not happy with the 2nd half of 'Sharmaji...': Director
223.article_body: Hitesh Bhatia, director of Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', has revealed that Rishi was not "very happy" with the second half of the film. "He...had a lot of input. He kept calling us after every three-four days, with ideas to discuss," he added. "It took us another two or three months to finish...draft...So he was quite involved," said Hitesh.

224.title: Delhi shuts 1,000 jab centres, terminates services of vaccinators
224.article_body: The Delhi government has shut over 1,000 jab centres that were operational in schools, non-health facilities as majority of its adult, teenage population have received their first dose of COVID vaccination. The services of around 1,900 contractual vaccinators, nurses and data-entry operators were also terminated. On Friday, Delhi conducted its vaccination drive only from 488 centres, data showed.

225.title: B'luru petrol prices reach ₹108.14/litre after 10th hike in 12 days
225.article_body: After fuel prices were hiked for the 10th time in 12 days, the price of petrol has reached ₹108.14/litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹92.05/litre, according to the Indian Express. In total, the price of petrol has gone up by ₹7.20/litre. Earlier, Karnataka Congress leaders had staged a protest against the hike in fuel prices in Bengaluru.

226.title: Mid-day meal scheme to be renamed after Dr Shivakumara Swamiji: K'taka CM
226.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday announced that the mid-day meal scheme in the state will be renamed after Dr Shivakumara Swamiji of Siddaganga Mutt in the Tumakuru district. The announcement came on the occasion of Swamiji's 115th birth anniversary. BJP's state vice-president and son of former CM BS Yediyurappa, BY Vijayendra had earlier proposed to rename the scheme.

227.title: KKR were stunned by PBKS' approach after losing wicket in 1st over: Shreyas
227.article_body: Discussing KKR's win in the IPL 2022 match against PBKS, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer admitted his team was stunned by PBKS' approach after losing a wicket in the first over. Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Shikhar Dhawan stitched a partnership of 41 runs off 17 balls, after the dismissal of Mayank Agarwal for 1. PBKS finished the powerplay on 62/3.

228.title: Taiwan shuts 39 schools amid rising COVID-19 cases
228.article_body: Taiwan on Friday shut 39 schools in 10 counties amid rising COVID-19 cases. Reportedly, many teachers and students have been infected with the virus. According to the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), Taiwan on Friday reported 104 domestic COVID-19 cases, most in 281 days. So far, Taiwan has reported more than 23,620 COVID-19 cases and over 850 coronavirus-related deaths.

229.title: Indian Post launches Maha's 1st e-vehicles batch for home delivery
229.article_body: The Pune office of the Indian Post on Friday launched Maharashtra's first batch of e-vehicles for doorstep parcel delivery. "If the pilot proves to be successful, we'll look at extending it to many other post offices in the city," Pune Region Post Master General G Madhumita Das said. She added that the initiative is for "leveraging the consequential environmental benefits".

230.title: Pant can overcome IPL strike rate issue in a single innings: Shastri
230.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who has recorded strike rates of 128.52 and 113.95 in the previous two editions of IPL, Ravi Shastri said Pant can overcome the issue over his strike rate in a single innings. "The thing I like about Pant the most is that his batting...captaincy isn't the same. As a captain, he's...a lot more composed," added Shastri.

231.title: When Bezos was in space, we were getting signs to unionise: Ex-Amazon worker
231.article_body:
Former Amazon worker Christian Smalls said he would like to thank Jeff Bezos for going to space, after the Amazon workers at the New York warehouse voted to form Amazon's first US union.
"When he was up there we were signing people up. We were out here getting signatures," Smalls said. Bezos went to space in July last year.

232.title: Tharoor moves Private Member's Bill to repeal UAPA, calls Act a 'tool of abuse'
232.article_body: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor came up with a Private Member’s Bill to repeal the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act in Lok Sabha on Friday. "It’s (UAPA) a tool of abuse in which 66% of cases involve no violence, 56% are detained w/no charge-sheet for two years & conviction rate since 2014 is an abysmal 2.4%," Tharoor said in a tweet.

233.title: Video of Carrey forcibly kissing Alicia resurfaces after his comment on Will Smith
233.article_body: A video of actor-comedian Jim Carrey forcibly kissing actress Alicia Silverstone on stage at an award ceremony in 1997 resurfaced after his comments on Will Smith-Chris Rock slap controversy. Carrey criticised Will Smith, saying he would've sued him for $200 million. "After seeing...clip of Carrey assaulting Silverstone, it was best if he had kept his mouth shut," a user tweeted.

234.title: India records its warmest March in 122 years
234.article_body: India, on average, recorded its warmest March days in 122 years with the maximum temperature across the country clocking in at 1.86°C above normal, an analysis by the India Meteorological Department (IMD) showed. The average maximum, minimum and mean temperatures for the country as a whole during March 2022 were 33.10°C, 20.24°C and 26.67°C, respectively.

235.title: Petrol gets costlier by ₹7.20 per litre with 10 hikes in 12 days
235.article_body: Petrol and diesel have become costlier by ₹7.20 per litre each as the prices have been hiked 10 times since a four-and-half-month long pause in rate revision ended on March 22. Petrol price neared ₹103 per litre in Delhi on Saturday and crossed ₹117 in Mumbai after a hike of over 80 paise. Diesel price hit ₹93.87/litre in Delhi.

236.title: Man jailed for threatening to behead US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi
236.article_body: A 60-year-old man has been sentenced to 18 months in prison for making death threats to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and Illinois prosecutor Kim Foxx. Paul Vernon Hoeffer had pleaded guilty in January to threatening to cut Pelosi's head off "jihadist style" and calling Ocasio-Cortez's office to tell her he would "rip her head off".

237.title: Mike Tyson completes dubbing for Deverakonda's 'Liger', says 'I'm grateful'
237.article_body: Former American boxer Mike Tyson has finished dubbing for the pan-India movie 'Liger', which features Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday in the lead roles. Dharma Productions, taking to Instagram on Friday, shared the news along with a video message from Tyson. "Thank you very much for being kind to me. I'm very grateful," he said. It's directed by Puri Jagannadh.

238.title: I'd love to but industry lacks unity: John on working in all-star action film
238.article_body: Actor John Abraham said in an interview that he would love to do an all-star action film, adding, "But I think as an industry where we lack is unity." "That's something you've got to learn from the South. They are cohesive, and that's fantastic," he added. John will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns', which also stars Arjun Kapoor.

239.title: Bihar electricity dept staffer rides horse to work amid fuel price hike
239.article_body: A Bihar electricity department staffer from Sheohar has been riding a horse from one village to another to collect electricity bills amid a rise in fuel prices. The staffer claimed that he was spending nearly ₹200/day on petrol to collect the bills using his motorcycle. Petrol and diesel prices were increased for the 10th time in 12 days on Saturday.

240.title: Habitual house burglar held in Hyd, valuables worth ₹1.3 cr recovered
240.article_body: A 50-year-old habitual house burglar was arrested by Vanasthalipuram police in Hyderabad on Friday. Police also recovered valuables worth ₹1.3 crore, including 230 tolas of gold, 10 kg silver and over ₹15,000 cash, from the accused. According to police, the accused, identified as Muchu Ambedkar, lives near Indira Park. He has been committing burglaries for past 30 years, police added.

241.title: Pay farmers within 72 hours of crop procurement: UP CM to officials
241.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday directed officials to pay the farmers within 72 hours of crop procurement. "Officers should make all the necessary arrangements for the procurement of wheat in their respective districts so that farmers don't face any problem," Adityanath said. Notably, the Centre has fixed the minimum support price (MSP) of wheat at ₹2,015 per quintal.

242.title: Police lathicharge villagers protesting mining project in Chhattisgarh, 25 injured
242.article_body: A clash broke out between police and local residents after the latter tried to enter the collector's office to submit a 20-point memorandum over the Rowghat iron ore mining project in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur. Protesters claimed that 25 people were injured after police lathicharged them. According to the villagers, mining will destroy minor forest produce, which is their source of livelihood.

243.title: BMC medical officer duped of ₹1.75 lakh after investing in crypto based app
243.article_body: A 25-year-old BMC medical officer was cheated of ₹1.75 lakh after she invested in a cryptocurrency based app. According to police, the woman, who had learnt about the app from a relative, initially received returns on her investment after which she invested larger sums. However, she stopped receiving payment in the past few weeks following which she contacted the police.

244.title: Class 10 student jumps to death over sexual harassment by headmaster in Odisha
244.article_body: A Class 10 girl student jumped to death from the roof of a hostel building over alleged sexual harassment by the school's headmaster in Odisha's Sundargarh, police said. The headmaster and school's warden were detained on Friday, police added. Several other students also alleged sexual harassment by the headmaster, the police officials, who spoke to other girls, said.

245.title: Truck driver kills self for ₹30,000 in Bengaluru
245.article_body: A 35-year-old truck driver, identified as Kiran Kumar, killed himself in Bengaluru's Sanjeevini Nagar after allegedly not receiving his salary from private logistics firm he used to work for. Kumar had sent a video to three of his colleagues demanding ₹30,000 to be paid to him within 30 minutes and warned of ending his life if he was not paid.

246.title: Lawsuit against Airbnb over host spying on couple goes to arbitrator
246.article_body: A US judge has said that the lawsuit brought against Airbnb by a couple, that was allegedly videotaped by a host, must go to an arbitrator. The couple had sued both the host and Airbnb. As per the Airbnb agreement, the couple is bound to have an arbitrator decide whether the dispute can be litigated in court, the judge said.

247.title: SC rejects plea by Maharashtra govt for SIT probe against Anil Deshmukh
247.article_body: Supreme Court has rejected the Maharashtra government's plea demanding a court-monitored Special Investigation Team (SIT) probe against former state Home Minister Anil Deshmukh. CBI's investigation can be biased as former Maharashtra Police chief Subodh Kumar Jaiswal is now the investigating agency's chief, the plea claimed. Deshmukh is being investigated in alleged corruption and bribery cases.

248.title: The ball takes a life of its own when you hit it: Shah Rukh Khan to Andre Russell
248.article_body: After Andre Russell scored 70*(31) to help KKR beat PBKS, KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Welcome back my friend...So long since saw the ball fly so high!" Shah Rukh added, "It takes a life of its own when you hit it...man!" Russell slammed eight sixes against PBKS, the most by a batter in an IPL 2022 match so far.

249.title: Infosys to shut Russia office amid pressure over Ukraine war: Reports
249.article_body: Indian IT major Infosys is closing its office in Russia after facing pressure to stop operating amid Russia's war with Ukraine, reports said. Earlier, UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak faced questions over his wife Akshata's stake in Infosys, which was co-founded by her father Narayana Murthy. Infosys is trying to find replacement roles abroad for Moscow employees, BBC reported.

250.title: 36-year-old woman in Gujarat moves HC seeking 'No Religion, No Caste' certificate
250.article_body: A 36-year old woman from Surat has moved Gujarat High Court with a petition seeking the court's directions to the authorities to issue her a 'No Religion, No Caste' certificate. Kajal Manjula, who originally belongs to Rajgor Brahmin community, stated that she has had to face "so many troubles in her life due to discriminatory caste system".

251.title: Kabir Singh was a modern aggressive version of SRK's Devdas: Shahid
251.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said his character in 'Kabir Singh' was a "modern aggressive version" of Shah Rukh Khan's character in the 2002 film 'Devdas'. "It is a man who destroys himself out of love for someone...The only difference is that man is reactive, aggressive," he added. 'Kabir Singh' was a remake of the 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy'.

252.title: SRK's son AbRam prays for KKR with fingers crossed during IPL match, pic viral
252.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's eight-year-old son AbRam was spotted praying for KKR at the stadium during their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. Shah Rukh's daughter Suhana took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture of AbRam, writing, "Think it worked." KKR defeated PBKS by six wickets, chasing down a 138-run target in 14.3 overs.

253.title: Law enforcement agencies get email threatening to kill PM, execute 20 attacks
253.article_body: Law enforcement agencies have confirmed that they had received an email threatening to kill PM Narendra Modi. "I have more than 20 RDX and I have planned 20 big attacks," the email stated. "We get such emails and letters at least once a month...But we are still not completely disregarding it and will track down the sender," an officer said.

254.title: Retreating Russians leaving mines around homes, bodies: Zelenskyy
254.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned people that retreating Russian forces are creating "a complete disaster" outside the capital Kyiv. "They're mining the whole territory. They're mining homes...equipment, even the bodies of people who were killed," he said. Zelenskyy urged residents to wait to resume their lives until they're assured the mines have been cleared and there's no danger.

255.title: Mumbai saw over 16,000 properties sale registration in March 2022: Data
255.article_body: Property sale registrations in Mumbai touched over 16,000 units in March 2022, contributing nearly ₹1,131 crore to the state's revenue, according to data by Maharashtra's Inspector General of Registration. Maximum registrations were in the price band of ₹1-5 crore and homes ranging between 500-1,000 sq ft were the most preferred category of properties registered in March 2022, the data revealed.

256.title: Bulldozers used in anti-encroachment drive in Bihar; video surfaces
256.article_body: A video has surfaced after Bihar State Housing Board used bulldozers in a drive to clear land encroachments in Patna's Rajiv Nagar. Multiple unauthorised buildings that had been constructed on the land which was marked for state police have been cleared. Earlier, Uttar Pradesh Police threatened to raze the houses of two rape accused with bulldozers if they don't surrender.

257.title: HC tells woman to pay ₹3,000/month to ex-husband in alimony case
257.article_body: Bombay High Court has directed a woman who works as a teacher to pay interim maintenance of ₹3,000/month to her divorced husband, saying that alimony can be claimed by either of the spouses. The former husband alleged that he has no income and had encouraged his wife to study while he managed the household. The plea seeks ₹15,000/month as alimony.

258.title: India reports 1,260 new COVID-19 cases, 83 deaths in last 24 hours
258.article_body: India has reported 1,260 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 13,445. Meanwhile, the death toll due to COVID-19 in the country has risen to 5,21,264 after 83 deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. India's total vaccination number is 1,84,52,44,856.

259.title: Kalicharan Maharaj, held over remarks against Mahatma Gandhi, gets bail
259.article_body: Self-proclaimed 'Godman' Kalicharan Maharaj, who was arrested in connection with a hate speech case, was granted bail after three months by the Chhattisgarh High Court on Friday. He was arrested under sedition charges for making derogatory remarks against Mahatma Gandhi at a 'Dharam Sansad'. Kalicharan was held by Raipur Police from Madhya Pradesh's Khajuraho on December 30, 2021.

260.title: Coin toss happened twice in the 2011 World Cup final
260.article_body: The coin was tossed twice in the 2011 World Cup final, which India won against Sri Lanka 11 years ago on April 2. MS Dhoni and Kumar Sangakkara both thought they had won the toss in the first attempt. Referee Jeff Crowe said he had not heard Sangakkara's call, after which the toss was redone and won by Sri Lanka.

261.title: Gautam Adani's fortune hits $100 billion mark, surpasses Mukesh Ambani's
261.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth has hit the $100 billion mark after surging by nearly $24 billion this year. He's the world's biggest gainer this year and now the world's 10th richest person, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani has overtaken Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, whose fortune stands at $99 billion, and become Asia's richest person again.

262.title: Will strengthen western borders so no one can think of attacking us: Russia
262.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin had ordered the military to strengthen the country's western borders "so that it wouldn't cross anyone's mind...to attack us", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday. Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu is working on a security plan, he added. Peskov alleged that unnamed nations were strengthening their military potential near Russia's western borders.

263.title: Meta staff to no longer require COVID-19 booster shots in the US
263.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta is no longer requiring its US employees to have COVID-19 boosters to enter its offices. "We updated our requirements in early March to align with CDC guidance, and now COVID-19 boosters are no longer required for entry," a Meta spokesperson said. However, its requirement of a 1- or 2-shot series of vaccination is still in place.

264.title: BBMP uploads budget online, breaks tradition of presenting it before public
264.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) for the first time uploaded the Budget for the 2022-23 fiscal on its website barely an hour before the end of March 31 which was the last day of the financial year 2021-22. The BBMP uploaded the budget online without any prior announcement and broke the traditional practice of presenting Budget before the media.

265.title: 5.5 lakh households in Ghaziabad to get unique IDs over property tax
265.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has decided to issue an 18-digit unique identification number to about 5.5 lakh households under its jurisdiction, officials said. About 1.68 lakh properties were never charged property tax, as per a GIS-based survey conducted by the civic body. "In future, the unique number may also be used for the provision of services," an official added.

266.title: Thane man falls from train into Mumbra creek; rescue op halted due to high tide
266.article_body: A 34-year-old man fell from a train into a creek in Thane's Mumbra on Friday, according to the civic body. Police said the man, who was taking his mother to a hospital in Ghatkopar, lost his balance when the train reached the bridge above the creek. Officials had launched a rescue operation, which was later halted due to high tide.

267.title: Explosion sounds on Shah's route in B'luru cause security scare
267.article_body: Explosion sounds heard on Union Minister Amit Shah's route in Bengaluru caused a security scare on Friday. After a police investigation, it was reportedly found that the explosion was due to a short circuit in the sewage system's underground electric cables in Vasanth Nagar area. The area was completely cleared for a security inspection to be certain of the cause.

268.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency amid protests over economic crisis
268.article_body: Sri Lanka has declared a nationwide state of emergency after protests over the country's worst economic crisis in decades turned violent. In a gazette notification, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said the decision was taken in the interests of public security. On Thursday, hundreds of protesters clashed with police outside Rajapaksa's house after tear gas was fired. Over 50 people were arrested.

269.title: Sachin Tendulkar had not let Virender Sehwag watch 2011 World Cup final live
269.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar hadn't let Virender Sehwag watch the 2011 World Cup final live, and neither watched it himself, despite being in the dressing room when India were chasing the 275-run target. Sachin revealed that in an earlier match, when they were getting a massage, India played well. Sachin stopped Sehwag from watching the final because of the same superstition.

270.title: NCB's witness in Aryan Khan drug case Prabhakar Sail dies due to heart attack
270.article_body: Prabhakar Sail, who was NCB's panch witness in the Mumbai cruise drug case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan, passed away due to heart attack on Friday. He was an independent witness and had accused NCB officials of extortion. Sail was the bodyguard of NCB witness Kiran Gosavi, the self-styled private detective whose selfie with Aryan went viral.

271.title: MS Dhoni's 2011 World Cup final bat is the most expensive bat ever
271.article_body: The bat MS Dhoni used to hit the 2011 World Cup final-winning six holds the record for being the most expensive cricket bat in history. Dhoni's bat was bought by Mumbai-based brokerage firm RK Global for £100,000 (then ₹72 lakh) at a charity dinner in London, three months after the final. The proceedings went to Dhoni's wife's charitable organisation.

272.title: Day temperatures in Pune likely to touch 40°C in next few days: IMD
272.article_body: As per India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials, the day temperatures in Pune may increase to 40°C in the next few days. "The sky is likely to remain clear. The night temperature in the city is likely to be around 15°C," IMD Pune's scientist Anupam Kashyapi said. According to Kashyapi, heatwave conditions in Maharashtra are likely to continue.

273.title: Gang kidnaps LPG cylinder delivery staff, extorts ₹2 lakh in Pune
273.article_body: Three people were arrested after a gang of six allegedly kidnapped two LPG cylinder delivery staff by intercepting the auto while posing as crime branch officials. The gang accused the staff of selling the cylinders in black market and demanded that they pay ₹5 lakh, but later released them after extorting ₹2 lakh from the duo's families, according to police.

274.title: Will Smith resigns from Oscars Academy over Chris slap, says 'I betrayed their trust'
274.article_body: Actor Will Smith has resigned from the Oscars Academy after slapping comedian Chris Rock on stage during last Sunday's ceremony. "My actions at...94th Academy Awards presentation were shocking, painful, and inexcusable," he said. Will added, "I betrayed the trust of the Academy. I deprived other nominees and winners of their opportunity to celebrate and be celebrated for their extraordinary work."

275.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 10th time in 12 days
275.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 10th time in 12 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹102.61/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹93.87/litre from ₹93.07/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹117.57/litre from ₹116.72/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹101.79/litre from ₹100.94/litre.

276.title: Delhi biker falls after getting entangled in kite string, loses ₹3 lakh
276.article_body: A 55-year-old man, who was carrying ₹6 lakh, fell off his bike after getting entangled in a kite string in Delhi's Shastri Park, police said. Following the accident, ₹3 lakh was stolen from him, police added. A loose kite string got entangled around the victim's neck, causing him to lose balance and fall on the road, police further said.

277.title: 45-yr-old man dies after AC compressor explodes at house in Gurugram
277.article_body: A 45-year-old man died after an air-conditioner compressor exploded, causing a fire at his house in Gurugram on Friday morning, police said. The deceased man was sleeping in his room when the incident took place. "Due to heavy smoke and suffocation, he could not even cry for help. He was charred to death in the fire," a police official said.

278.title: Groups for FIFA World Cup 2022 announced; Spain, Germany in same group
278.article_body: Four-time champions Germany and FIFA World Cup 2010 winners Spain will face each other in the group stage of FIFA World Cup 2022. The tournament's defending champions France have been placed along with Denmark and Tunisia in Group D. Meanwhile, hosts Qatar have been placed along with Ecuador, Senegal and Netherlands in Group A.

279.title: Can anyone not be happy for him: Bhogle on Umesh's 8 wickets in 3 IPL games
279.article_body: Complimenting Umesh Yaadav after he became highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022, commentator Harsha Bhogle said, "Can anyone not be happy for Umesh. Only two games in the last two years and already eight wickets in three games." He added, "He is bowling as well as he has [been]." Posting 4-1-23-4 against PBKS, Umesh registered his best-ever bowling figures in IPL.

280.title: Strong man in purple form: Harbhajan on Umesh's 4 wickets in KKR vs PBKS
280.article_body: Praising KKR pacer Umesh Yaadav on picking four wickets against PBKS and becoming highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with total eight wickets from three matches, Harbhajan Singh said, "Strong man Umesh in purple form for team purple and gold- KKR." He tweeted, "Keep it up champion." KKR bowled-out PBKS at 137 in 18.2 overs. Umesh registered bowling figures of 4-1-23-4.

281.title: KKR defeat PBKS as Andre Russell smashes most sixes in an IPL 2022 match so far
281.article_body: KKR chased down the target of 138 runs in 14.3 overs against PBKS to register their second win in IPL 2022. The match witnessed Andre Russell smash eight maximums, the most sixes hit by a batter in IPL 2022 so far. Russell scored 70*(31) and stitched an unbeaten 90-run partnership with Sam Billings to help KKR win.

282.title: Germany has reached peak of Omicron wave of COVID-19: Health agency
282.article_body: Germany's health agency Robert Koch Institute (RKI) on Thursday said Germany has reached the peak of the Omicron wave of COVID-19. Germany on Thursday reported 274,901 new COVID-19 cases. Around 76% of the population is fully vaccinated with nearly 60% of people having received a booster shot. RKI said "more than 1.5 million COVID-19 cases were reported within one week."

283.title: Rupee-rouble trade has been ongoing for years: Russian Foreign Minister
283.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, who's visiting India, said on Friday that the rupee-rouble payments system has been going on for many years. "The reason for moving towards national currencies...is the unreliable nature of our Western counterparts," he added. He further said, "We don't want to be a part of a system whose masters can steal your money overnight."

284.title: TN govt reserves 2 berths for women in SETC sleeper buses
284.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Transport Department on Friday announced that two berths, 1 LB and 4 LB, will be reserved for women in all AC and non-AC sleeper buses run by State Express Transport Corporation. If both berths aren't booked before departure, driver or conductor may change them to general category. Women can either reserve seats online or at ticket counters.

285.title: Amazon workers at NY warehouse vote to form company's first US union
285.article_body: Workers at an Amazon warehouse in New York's Staten Island have voted in favour of forming a union, making it the e-commerce giant's first facility in the US to organise. The workers secured a majority as 2,654 voted in favour of joining the union, while 2,131 opposed. Amazon is the second largest private employer in the US, Reuters said.

286.title: Bulldozers have started crushing people under BJP rule: Akhilesh
286.article_body: Criticising the BJP, Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav has said that bulldozers have started crushing people under the party's rule. "Inflation is increasing day by day. The government is playing with lives of people by being insensitive and careless," he added. Notably, the BJP had promoted "bulldozer" as a symbol of development and action against criminals during UP Assembly polls.

287.title: 8 killed, 20 injured in coal mine accident in Serbia
287.article_body: Authorities on Friday said at least eight people were killed and 20 injured after a mine shaft collapsed in Serbia. "Inspectors, police, and all relevant authorities are at the scene, doing what is necessary to determine the cause of this tragedy," Mining and Energy Minister Zorana Mihajlovic said. Initial reports suggest a methane explosion is the cause of the accident.

288.title: Pak's Punjab to elect new CM on Saturday amid political crisis
288.article_body: The Governor of Pakistan's Punjab province, Chaudhry Mohammad Sarwar, has summoned a session of the Assembly on Saturday for the election of a new CM. Usman Buzdar had resigned as CM on Monday after a no-confidence motion was presented against him. This comes amid a political crisis in Pakistan that was sparked by a no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan.

289.title: 'Ukraine struck Russian fuel depot', says Russia amid peace talks, shares video
289.article_body: Russia on Friday accused Ukraine of carrying out an airstrike against a fuel depot in the Russian city of Belgorod, amid peace talks with Ukraine. Russian officials claimed two Ukrainian helicopters struck the facility, leaving two injured. A video of the fire caused by the alleged attack was also shared by the Russian Emergencies Ministry, while Ukraine didn't claim responsibility.

290.title: PBKS' Odean Smith bowls most expensive over of IPL 2022 so far
290.article_body: Punjab Kings' Odean Smith bowled the most expensive over of IPL 2022 against KKR after conceding 30 runs in his second over of the match. Smith was hit for four sixes and one four in the over. He also bowled a no-ball, on which Andre Russell took a single. Out of the four sixes, three were hit by Russell.

291.title: I call myself 'spin-fast' bowler who prefers bowling at around 100 kmph: Rashid Khan
291.article_body: Gujarat Titans vice-captain Rashid Khan has said that he calls himself a 'spin-fast' bowler because of the pace at which he bowls. He added, "The speed at which I bowl is somewhere around 96-100 kmph. It's hard to generate turn at that pace, but I'd rather bowl at that speed than bring it down to 70-75 kmph."

292.title: Italy ends COVID-19 state of emergency after 2 years, lifts curbs
292.article_body: Italy on Friday ended a COVID-19 state of emergency initially announced two years ago and began lifting curbs. Attendance limits for sports venues and a requirement for people aged over 50 to show vaccination proof to enter their place of work have been lifted. Italy has reported over 14.6 million cases and 159,383 deaths since the pandemic began.

293.title: Dealing with pressure in last 5 overs of game: Hesson on RCB's new strategy
293.article_body: RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the side has come up with a new strategy that'll help players in dealing with pressure in last five overs of the match whether they are bowling or batting. "No matter what option...field you have, you have to have at least three options in terms of deliveries you can bowl," he stated.

294.title: COVID-19 deaths increased globally by 43% last week: WHO
294.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said between March 21 and 27, the number of deaths due to COVID-19 increased globally by 43%. The number of new COVID-19 cases decreased by 14% during the same period. WHO said over 10 million new cases and over 45,000 new deaths were reported last week across the six WHO regions.

295.title: Churches, historical sites, museums damaged by war in Ukraine: UN
295.article_body: UN Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) on Friday said many churches, historical sites and museums have been damaged by war in Ukraine. “We are very concerned about both the situation at the humanitarian, cultural heritage levels...” Ernesto Ottone, UNESCO’s Assistant Director-General for Culture said. The agency added that 29 religious sites were destroyed in the war.

296.title: My life is in danger: Pakistan PM Imran Khan ahead of no-confidence vote
296.article_body: Pakistan's PM Imran Khan told ARY News, "My life is at risk too, they (Opposition) have also planned for my character assassination. Not only myself but my wife too." Earlier, Pakistan Minister Fawad Chaudhry claimed that a plot to assassinate Khan was reported by the security agencies. This comes ahead of Sunday's no-confidence motion in the National Assembly against Khan.

297.title: BJP becomes first party to cross 100-seat mark in Rajya Sabha since 1990
297.article_body: The BJP has achieved 101 seats in the Rajya Sabha for the first time in its history and has become the first party since 1990 to do so. This came after the party won four of the 13 seats up for election in the 245-member Upper House in the latest round of polls that concluded on Thursday.

298.title: Russian forces are regrouping not withdrawing in Ukraine: NATO
298.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Thursday said Russian troops are regrouping and not withdrawing from Ukraine despite promises by Russia of a partial withdrawal of troops. "The Ukrainian forces are now bigger, better equipped, better trained and better led than ever before," he said. Stoltenberg warned Ukraine of "additional offensive actions, bringing even more suffering."

299.title: Soldiers who drink not Indians?: Tejashwi on CM's 'Mahapaapi' remark
299.article_body: Commenting on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's "people who drink alcohol aren't Indians but 'Mahapaapi'" remark, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday said that going by his logic, Indian soldiers who drink are also not Indians. Taking to Twitter, Yadav added, "Criminals who spill rivers of blood and the corrupt aren't 'mahapaapi' (sinners) or 'maha-ayogya' (good-for-nothing people) but drinkers are?"

300.title: Israeli forces shot dead Palestinian in occupied West Bank
300.article_body: Palestinian Health Ministry on Friday said Israeli forces shot dead a Palestinian resident during clashes between Palestinian residents and Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank city of Hebron. As per Israeli forces, they killed the man after he threw a firebomb at them. This comes after three Palestinians were killed on Thursday in two separate incidents.

301.title: BJP's Suvendu suspended from WB Assembly, likens move to Emergency
301.article_body: BJP MLA and Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari was on Thursday suspended from West Bengal Assembly for the remainder of the session that began on March 7. He said the decision reminds him of Emergency and called it a "dark chapter in the history of Indian politics". Adhikari was suspended days after BJP and TMC MLAs clashed over Birbhum violence.

302.title: FIFA reveal 'La'eeb' as World Cup 2022 mascot, share pic
302.article_body: FIFA have unveiled La'eeb as the official mascot for this year's World Cup, which will be held in Qatar. "La'eeb is an Arabic word meaning super-skilled player. He belongs to a parallel mascot-verse that is indescribable...everyone is invited to interpret what it looks like," FIFA said. "La'eeb encourages everyone to believe in themselves as 'Now is All'," it added.

303.title: 23-yr-old tourist, guide killed while paragliding in North Sikkim
303.article_body: A 23-year-old tourist from Telangana and her guide died while paragliding in North Sikkim's Lachung on Friday. Esha Reddy and her 26-year-old guide Sandeep Gurung took off from Lachung View Point, following which they lost balance due to the strong winds and fell into the Lachung river, police said, adding they were swept away by the strong currents.

304.title: Russian invasion killed over 150 children, hurt 245 so far: Ukraine
304.article_body: Office of the prosecutor general of Ukraine on Friday said 153 children were killed since Russian invasion began on February 24. The office added that 245 children were injured in Ukraine so far. Reportedly, at 73, the Kyiv region reported the most number of deaths followed by Donetsk and Kharkiv with 65 and 46 fatalities respectively.

305.title: Ensure patients get best facilities in all hospitals: UP CM Yogi
305.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday chaired a high-level meeting with officials and asked them to ensure that patients get the best facilities in all hospitals and medical colleges in the state. He directed them to conduct a detailed physical review of fire safety and electrical safety mechanisms at these places. "System should be updated to avoid...mishap," he added.

306.title: China will pursue peace in Ukraine in its own way: Chinese PM to EU
306.article_body: Chinese PM Li Keqiang on Friday told European Union (EU) leaders that China would push for peace in Ukraine in "its own way". During the virtual summit, the EU asked China not to allow Russia to circumvent Western sanctions imposed over the invasion of Ukraine. Notably, China has forged closer energy, trade and security ties with Russia in recent years.

307.title: Turkey's Erdogan calls for dialogue between Russia, Ukraine
307.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Friday called for dialogue between Russia and Ukraine, in a call with Russian President Vladimir Putin. In a statement, the Turkish presidency quoted Erdogan and said the "positive and constructive" talks had raised hopes for peace. This comes after the two leaders discussed peace talks between Russian and Ukrainian officials this week.

308.title: 2 UK teenagers charged over Lapsus$ hacks that hit Microsoft, Nvidia
308.article_body: The City of London Police have charged two teenagers, aged 16 and 17, with multiple cyber offences linked to an investigation into the Lapsus$ hacking group. The police did not reveal the identities of the teenagers because they are minors. The Lapsus$ hacking group, which first surfaced in December 2021, has targeted companies including Microsoft, Nvidia, Samsung, Ubisoft and Okta.

309.title: How does Farah's *ss taste? Urfi on Kashmera's 'Instagram famous' remark
309.article_body: 'Bigg Boss OTT' fame Urfi Javed has reacted to actress Kashmera Shah's remark calling her 'famous on Instagram and not anywhere else', saying, "You are not famous in either of them, what's the point?" Urfi further said, "How does Farah's *ss taste?" Earlier, designer Farah Khan Ali had stated that Urfi needs to be reprimanded for her distasteful dressing.

310.title: US raises $204 mn in humanitarian aid for Afghanistan
310.article_body: US on Thursday announced $204 million in humanitarian aid for people of Afghanistan. "This funding will provide emergency cash, shelter...and reintegration assistance to internally displaced...in Afghanistan and refugee populations in neighbouring countries," said US Agency for International Development (USAID). Afghanistan plunged into crisis since Taliban took over in August last year.

311.title: 'RRR' becomes 2nd-highest grossing movie in India, earns over ₹500cr in a week
311.article_body: SS Rajamouli directorial 'RRR' concluded its first week at the Indian box office with ₹560 crore earnings, making it the second-biggest grosser ever in the country. It surpasses the earnings of 'Dangal' (₹511 crore) and now stands next to 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' (over ₹1,000 crore). As per film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, 'RRR' has grossed ₹710 crore worldwide.

312.title: World no. 16 Alcaraz beats Kecmanovic to reach Miami Open semi-finals
312.article_body: World number 16 Carlos Alcaraz on Thursday beat Miomir Kecmanovic 6-7(5), 6-3, 7-6(5) to reach the semi-finals of the Miami Open. Alcaraz reached his second consecutive ATP Masters 1000 semi-finals after making it to the final four in Indian Wells last month. The 18-year-old will face defending champion Hubert Hurkacz in the semi-final.

313.title: Pune corporation takes steps to tackle rodents inside PMC office
313.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has taken steps to address the complaints of frequent incidents of spotting snakes and rats inside the office. "The building is close to the river so the snake managed to sneak in... Directions have been given to shift... on the top floor," said Executive Engineer Yuvraj Deshmukh. Notably, the PMC's health department is also informed.

314.title: Germany charges ex-military officer with spying for Russia
314.article_body: German prosecutors on Friday charged former military reserve officer with spying for a Russian intelligence service for years. As per the prosecutors, the indictment against the suspect was filed on March 16 at the state court in Dusseldorf. They added that the suspect was allegedly in contact with Russian intelligence "via various people" by October 2014.

315.title: Instagram rolls out 7 new messaging features including 'Silent messages'
315.article_body: Instagram is rolling out seven new messaging features - 'Reply while you browse', 'Quickly send to friends', 'See who’s online', 'Play, pause, and re-play', 'Send messages quietly', 'Lo-fi chat' and 'Create a poll with your squad'. Users will now be able to send messages without notifying friends late at night or when they're busy by adding "@silent" in their messages.

316.title: It's great to be back: Cummins on joining KKR camp in Mumbai for IPL
316.article_body: On joining KKR's squad in Mumbai for IPL 2022, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said, "It's been over a year since...first half of last IPL. It's great to be back." Cummins had missed second leg of IPL 2021 in UAE due to paternity leave. Cummins led his side to a 1-0 win against Pakistan in recently concluded three-match Test series.

317.title: 8.5% drop in Bundesliga revenue, largely due to COVID-19: Report
317.article_body: A report by the German Football League (DFL) said that the revenue generated by the Bundesliga clubs in 2020-21 got reduced by over 8.5% to $3.84 billion. "Sadly, it (COVID-19) is also affecting the current season, primarily because once again the stands often had to remain empty," said Donata Hopfen, speaker of the DFL Executive Committee.

318.title: World no. 2 Swiatek wins 16th straight match to reach Miami Open final
318.article_body: World number two Iga Swiatek on Thursday beat Jessica Pegula 6-2, 7-5 to claim her 16th consecutive match-win and reach the final of the Miami Open. Swiatek's semi-final win also means she has reached her third straight WTA 1000 final. The 20-year-old, who will become the world number one on Monday, will face Japan's Naomi Osaka in the final.

319.title: Nick Kyrgios fined $35,000 for his behaviour at Miami Open
319.article_body: Tennis' governing body ATP on Thursday said Nick Kyrgios has been fined $35,000 for his behaviour during his fourth-round loss to Jannik Sinner at the Miami Open. Kyrgios was fined $20,000 for verbal abuse, $10,000 for unsportsmanlike conduct and $5,000 for audible obscenity. The ATP added that Kyrgios repeatedly criticised the umpire and smashed his racket during the match.

320.title: It’s no fun at all: Mercedes boss Wolff on team’s current struggles
320.article_body: Mercedes team boss Toto Wolff described his team's current struggles as "no fun at all." Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton finished 10th in the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix with teammate George Russell finishing fifth. "It's an exercise in humility and it's going to make us stronger in the end, even though it's not fun right now," Wolff said.

321.title: Israel and UAE complete negotiations for free trade agreement
321.article_body: Israel and the UAE have concluded negotiations for a free trade agreement (FTA), Israel's Economy Ministry announced on Friday. The agreement seeks to abolish customs duties on "95 percent of the products" exchanged between the two countries, it said. "This milestone deal will...cement one of the world's most important and promising emerging trading relationships," the UAE said.

322.title: Amazon's Andy Jassy gets $212 million compensation in his 1st year as CEO
322.article_body: Amazon's Andy Jassy, who took over as CEO in July 2021, received a compensation of about $212 million last year. While Jassy's base salary remained unchanged at $175,000, the vast majority of his compensation came in the form of a stock award of 61,000 shares. That award "is expected to represent most of Jassy's compensation for coming years", Amazon said.

323.title: Bowlers enjoy talking to him: Sangakkara on RR's fast-bowling coach Malinga
323.article_body: Talking about RR fast-bowling coach Lasith Malinga, Director of Cricket Operations and head coach Kumar Sangakkara said it's "exciting and huge" to have him. "Bowlers really enjoy talking to him, while he's there at the top of their marks. Discussing...debating fields and deliveries. He's been exceptional," he added. "He's just directing the players to keep things simple," Sangakkara further said.

324.title: Portugal’s Bruno Fernandes signs new long-term contract with Man Utd
324.article_body: Manchester United on Friday announced that Portuguese midfielder Bruno Fernandes has signed a new long-term contract with the club until June 2026 with an option to extend a further year. Fernandes, 27, has scored 49 goals and registered 39 assists in 117 appearances in all competitions for Manchester United. Fernandes joined the club from Sporting Lisbon in January 2020.

325.title: Ranbir is the cat, I'm the dog in our relationship: Alia Bhatt
325.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that her boyfriend actor Ranbir Kapoor is the cat and she is the dog in their relationship. Alia further said she sometimes wakes up with a lot of energy and Ranbir calms her down. "He is way calmer than I am...I rely a lot on him to pass on some of that calmness," she added.

326.title: Skill of B'wood actors is unsurpassed, don't have it in H'wood: Jake
326.article_body: Actor Jake Gyllenhaal in an interview has stated that the skill of Bollywood actors is unsurpassed. He added that being able to sing, dance and act at the same time is a real requirement which isn't there in Hollywood. "The films in Bollywood are so inspiring...I have so much admiration for the filmmaking and...acting coming out of India," Jake said.

327.title: Tried not to be too hard on myself after breakup with Camila: Shawn
327.article_body: Singer Shawn Mendes has spoken about his breakup with singer-actress Camila Cabello, saying that he gave himself a lot of grace and tried not to be too hard on himself about his feelings. "It was learning how to trust...again...Instead of...calling just one person, I [now had] six people I could call and like balancing out that," Shawn said.

328.title: Ram Nath Kovind becomes first Indian Prez to visit Turkmenistan
328.article_body: Ram Nath Kovind on Friday became the first Indian President to visit Turkmenistan, according to Rashtrapati Bhavan. "President Ram Nath Kovind was received by President Serdar Berdimuhamedov...and accorded a ceremonial guard of honour on his arrival at the Ashgabat airport," it tweeted. "The state visit of the President will reaffirm the importance we attach to Turkmenistan," an official said.

329.title: 6 wolves die in Indore zoo in 3 days after rabies outbreak
329.article_body: Six of the eight wolves at the Kamla Nehru Zoo in MP's Indore have died of rabies within three days. The wolves were kept in separate cages, the zoo in-charge Uttam Yadav said, adding that the remaining two wolves haven't shown rabies-like symptoms yet. "The cause of the outbreak is yet to be known," he further said.

330.title: It was like Niagara Falls in terms of wetness: Fleming on dew after CSK's loss
330.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming compared the dew during his team's IPL 2022 defeat against LSG to the Niagara Falls. Justifying their move to make all-rounder Shivam Dube bowl the 19th over, Fleming said, "Spinning options were taken out of play because it was like Niagara Falls in terms of the wetness." Dube conceded 25 runs in the 19th over.

331.title: I have enough, I've done enough: Jim Carrey announces retirement
331.article_body: Actor-comedian Jim Carrey has stated that he will retire from acting after 'Sonic the Hedgehog 2', saying, "I have enough. I've done enough. I am enough." He further said that he likes his quiet life and putting paint on canvas. "If the angels bring some...script...that...is going to be really important for people to see, I might continue," Jim added.

332.title: Woman attempts self-immolation outside BJP office in UP's Lucknow
332.article_body: A woman from UP's Gosainganj tried to set herself on fire outside BJP's Lucknow office on Friday. The woman said she took the step as her son had been forcibly sent to jail by the local police despite being innocent. Her self-immolation attempt was, however, stopped by the policemen on duty outside the office and the matter is being investigated.

333.title: Domestic PNG gets costlier by ₹5.85 in Delhi & Noida as IGL hikes prices
333.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited said on Friday that it's hiking the price of domestic PNG by ₹5.85 from April 1 to partially cover the hike in input gas cost. With this, per standard cubic metre (SCM) will cost ₹41.61, including VAT, in Delhi. It will cost ₹41.71/SCM in Gautam Buddha Nagar. Previously, the price was hiked on March 24.

334.title: Time not apt to discard COVID-related precautions: ICMR-NIV official
334.article_body: Priya Abraham, Director of ICMR-NIV, said on Friday that the time is not right to discard coronavirus-related precautions. Her comments came at a time when states like Maharashtra and Telangana made mask-wearing optional. "Right now COVID-19 infections are low, it's...good. In any crowded place, we must wear a mask...A mask definitely has a role in containing the spread," she explained.

335.title: Hindi film industry struggling to find good stories: Shahid Kapoor
335.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor in an interview has stated that he feels that the Hindi film industry is struggling to find good stories. "It is important to recognise the fact that today a real star...or someone who is widely connecting with people would be the kind of person who collaborates with the right kind of content creators," the actor added.

336.title: 8,278 Indian prisoners in foreign jails: Govt to Lok Sabha
336.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan has informed the Lok Sabha that 8,278 Indian prisoners, including undertrials, are lodged in foreign prisons at present. Of these, 156 are serving life sentences, he added. The government attaches the highest priority to the safety and well-being of Indians in foreign countries, including those in prisons, he further said.

337.title: Man shares pic of Tharoor as child actor, 'tried to keep it secret', says the MP
337.article_body: Film writer Vaibhav Vishal on Friday shared a still from a movie that Congress MP Shashi Tharoor acted in as a child, saying, "[Tharoor's] screen name was Master Gyaan and he did nine Hindi and Malayalam films." Reacting to the picture, Tharoor said, "And I had tried to keep it secret all along! Good sleuthing...I'm still known as Master Gyaan."

338.title: Future Retail misses due date to repay ₹5,322 crore to its lenders
338.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) on Friday said it has missed the due date for the repayment of ₹5,322.32 crore to various banks and lenders. The company also said that it failed to raise ₹3,900 crore before March 31, 2022, under the One Time Restructuring (OTR) scheme. FRL said it was unable to do so due to the ongoing litigations with Amazon.

339.title: Corporate India's mood is cautiously optimistic: Uday Kotak
339.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak said that corporate India's mood is "cautiously optimistic" now that the post-COVID-19 economy is showing signs of bouncing back. Speaking about inflation, Kotak told CNBC-TV18, "India is not so much out of line given our inflation. The path we...need to traverse is a smaller move compared to what the developed markets have to."

340.title: IIM Ahmedabad plans to change logo; 45 faculty members oppose the change
340.article_body: At least 45 faculty members have opposed a proposal to change IIM Ahmedabad logo, saying, "it'll have long-term consequences" on the institute's brand. Following criticism, IIM Ahmedabad said, "The proposed logo retains the status line in Sanskrit (Vidya Viniyogadvikasa) as in the original." It added, "The 'jaali'-inspired brand mark has been made more amenable to communication in digital media."

341.title: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship stuck near Baltimore for 3 weeks
341.article_body: Evergreen Marine Corporation's 1,096-foot container ship 'Ever Forward' ran aground in the Chesapeake Bay after departing the Port of Baltimore's Seagirt Marine Terminal on March 13 and hasn't moved since, according to Bloomberg. After two failed attempts, Evergreen is planning another attempt as early as Sunday to free the ship. In 2021, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship blocked the Suez Canal.

342.title: PM meets Russian Foreign Minister in Delhi, briefed about situation in Ukraine
342.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday met Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov during the latter's official two-day visit and was briefed on the situation in Ukraine, including the ongoing peace negotiations. The Prime Minister's Office said PM reiterated his call for early cessation of violence and conveyed India's readiness to contribute in any way to the peace efforts.

343.title: John Abraham advised me 'Learn when to say no': Raashii Khanna
343.article_body: Actress Raashii Khanna has revealed that her 'Madras Cafe' co-star John Abraham advised her to learn when to say no and take it seriously in life. The actress added that this is exactly what she has done in her professional life. She further said that she didn't fill the gaps in her career with films she didn't want to do.

344.title: Afghanistan appoints ex-Pakistan pacer Umar Gul as bowling coach
344.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Umar Gul has been appointed as Afghanistan's bowling coach and consultant. "Looking forward to imparting the best of...knowledge that I have and making it worth it for the boys," Gul wrote on Twitter. He'll be joining team's national camp on April 4. Gul represented Pakistan in 47 Tests, 130 ODIs and 60 T20Is and took 427 wickets.

345.title: 3 terrorist associates of JeM arrested in Pulwama, ammunition seized
345.article_body: Three terrorist associates of Jaish-e-Mohammed were arrested by the police in the Pulwama district of J&K on Friday. A preliminary probe revealed that they were involved in providing logistics and transportation to terrorists in the district, reports said quoting police. Incriminating materials, weaponry and ammunition, including an AK rifle and a grenade, were seized from their possession.

346.title: US' oldest active park ranger retires at 100
346.article_body: The US' oldest active park ranger, Betty Reid Soskin, has retired at the age of 100 on Thursday, National Park Service said. Soskin had worked at Rosie the Riveter/WWII Home Front National Historical Park, which honours women who worked in factories during wartime, in California. "Betty has made a profound impact on the National Park Service," Director Chuck Sams said.

347.title: Centre sought ₹7.5 cr for military sent during Pathankot attack: Punjab CM
347.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday alleged that he had received a letter from the Centre, saying that Punjab must pay ₹7.5 crore for the military that was sent during the 2016 Pathankot attack. "I went to Rajnath Singh. Told him to deduct from my MPLAD but give in writing that Punjab isn't the country's part," he added.

348.title: NASA observatory studies neighbouring galaxy from Chile
348.article_body: NASA's Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy (SOFIA) collected data on the Large Magellanic Cloud, one of the closest galaxies to our Milky Way from Santiago, Chile. "This mission here in Chile will help us...produce a very important science paper on the Magellanic Cloud characteristics in the near future," said Ed Harmon, manager of operations for SOFIA.

349.title: Bhuvan Bam apologises as NCW seeks FIR against him for 'objectifying' women in video
