349.article_body: After the NCW requested the Delhi Police to file an FIR against YouTuber and actor Bhuvan Bam for allegedly objectifying women in a video, he issued an apology. "I'm aware that a section in my video has hurt some people. I have edited it to remove that part," said Bhuvan. The video titled 'Automatic Gaadi' has over 12 million views.

350.title: Online wildlife trade rose by 74% from 2020-2021 in Myanmar: WWF
350.article_body: A report by World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) has found that online illegal wildlife trade in Myanmar increased by 74% from 2020 to 2021. A total of 173 species, including 54 species that are threatened with global extinction, were traded during the same period. The report claimed that 11,046 wildlife items were promoted for sale through social media posts.

351.title: Jaya holds screening of Abhishek Bachchan's 'Dasvi' for MPs
351.article_body: Actress-turned-politician Jaya Bachchan organised a special screening of her son actor Abhishek Bachchan's upcoming film 'Dasvi' for her fellow Members of the Parliament in Mumbai. Maharashtra MP Rajani Patil and Maharashtra MP and deputy leader of Shiv Sena Priyanka Chaturvedi took to social media to share pictures from the event. 'Dasvi' was earlier screened for inmates in Agra Central Jail.

352.title: Had to fight for respect: Kim on divorce with Kanye, relationship with Pete
352.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian has stated that she "absolutely" feels like she had to fight to gain respect from others. Her statement comes amid her divorce with rapper Kanye West and relationship with comedian Pete Davidson. Kim further said, "It's hard to live your life on a reality show and then say I want certain things to be private."

353.title: Russia withdraws some troops in Ukraine's Chernihiv, Kyiv: Report
353.article_body: Governors of Ukraine's Chernihiv and Kyiv on Friday said some of the Russian troops are withdrawing from their regions. "We are observing the movement of joint Russian vehicle columns of various quantities," Kyiv region's governor, Oleksandr Pavlyuk said. Meanwhile, Chernihiv Governor Viacheslav Chaus said some Russian troops had pulled back but some remained in the region.

354.title: IIFA Awards 2022 nominees revealed, 'Shershaah' leads with 12 nominations
354.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Shershaah' has topped the IIFA Awards 2022 nominations with 12 nominations, including Best Picture, Best Actor and Best Actress among others. Other nominees for Best Picture are - '83', 'Sardar Udham', 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and 'Thappad'. Ranveer Singh, Vicky Kaushal, Late Irrfan Khan, Vidya Balan, Kriti Sanon and others bagged nominations.

355.title: Even they never win: Akhtar on similarity between PBKS and Lahore Qalandars
355.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that IPL's PBKS are similar to Lahore Qalandars from Pakistan Super League (PSL) as both teams weren't able to win their respective leagues. "Finally, this year they [Lahore Qalandars] won...final. So I hope that like Punjab from our side, even...Punjab from your side should do something," he stated. PBKS won their opening match against RCB.

356.title: BJP should hold 'charcha' on UP paper leak: Priyanka Gandhi
356.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday said the BJP should hold a discussion on the UP paper leak incident. Her remarks came after the UP Secondary School Board's Class 12 English examination was cancelled in 24 districts on Wednesday following the leak of the question paper. Priyanka said, "The paper leak system has a strong foothold in the government."

357.title: Sustainability board proposes new standards for company emissions
357.article_body: The International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB) on Thursday set out its first guidelines for company sustainability reporting. The ISSB proposed two new standards with the first of them setting general sustainability related financial disclosures. While the second one details specific climate-related disclosure requirements which means data on the company's direct and indirect emissions.

358.title: Nepalese PM arrives in India on 3-day visit, meets BJP chief Nadda
358.article_body: Nepalese PM Sher Bahadur Deuba arrived in India on Friday for his three-day visit to the country. BJP chief JP Nadda welcomed him at the party's headquarters in Delhi. Deuba also met External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today, while on Saturday, he will meet PM Narendra Modi. Notably, this is Deuba's first visit to India since assuming office last year.

359.title: Working with John isn't like actor-director thing: 'Attack' director
359.article_body: 'Attack' director Lakshya Raj Anand has stated that working with John Abraham isn't like "an actor-director thing", adding that they are one team. "Our main point was to get amazing action scenes, shoot it at...higher scale and give audiences a new way of storytelling," he added. Lakshya further said that he and John created the idea for the film together.

360.title: Nepal PM Deuba visits India for 1st time after assuming post
360.article_body: Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba visited India for the first time after assuming the position for the fifth time. Along with PM Deuba, his spouse and a delegation of 50 members including Foreign Minister Narayan Khadka have also arrived in the country. During the visit, Deuba is scheduled to meet PM Narendra Modi and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar.

361.title: KKR, PBKS announce their playing XIs, both teams make one change each
361.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 match on Friday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Sheldon Jackson. PBKS have also made one change to their team, with Kagiso Rabada replacing Sandeep Sharma.

362.title: Let me firmly confirm I haven't quit 'The Kapil Sharma Show': Sumona
362.article_body: Actress Sumona Chakravarti, addressing rumours of not being a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', stated, "Let me firmly confirm that I haven't quit...and don't intend to do it either." The actress will be seen in travel show 'Shonar Bangla' which will feature her exploring West Bengal. "The...show is a short one-month commitment that facilitates...my [passion for] travel," Sumona added.

363.title: Venkatesh seemed fidgety in KKR's last game vs RCB: Jaffer
363.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said KKR opener Venkatesh Iyer looked "fidgety" and under pressure to score runs in the last match against RCB in IPL 2022. "He played some strange shots. I guess he couldn't get used to the bounce at DY Patil Stadium," he added. Venkatesh, who scored 14-ball 10, was caught and bowled by Akash Deep.

364.title: Hyd Police seizes 900 gm of poppy straw concentrate, 2 arrested
364.article_body: Hyderabad Police caught two interstate drug peddlers on Thursday and recovered around 900 grams of poppy straw concentrate from them. Police also seized a car, cash and mobiles worth a total of ₹15 lakh. According to police, one of the accused procured drugs from Punjab and delivered them to the second accused in Hyderabad, who then sold them to customers.

365.title: Papa Johar will cry in hiding: Kangana as 'Lock Upp' hits 200mn views
365.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to announce that her reality show 'Lock Upp' has crossed 200 million views. She wrote, "Sari changu mangu sena/ media of cruella/ papa jo along with him going to cry chup chup ke (The army of chipmunks/ media of Cruella/ Papa Johar along with himself are going to cry in hiding)."

366.title: Free libraries being set up in Mumbai parks to encourage kids to read
366.article_body: The BMC is setting up free libraries in 24 parks in each of the 24 Mumbai wards on trial basis with an aim to inculcate reading habits in children. The initiative is a part of several activities being taken up under CSR, Additional Municipal Commissioner Ashwini Bhide said. Other programmes, such as musical mornings and evenings, are also being implemented.

367.title: Pope apologises to Canada's indigenous for abuses at church-run schools
367.article_body: Pope Francis apologised for the "deplorable" abuses suffered by indigenous people in Canada in the church-run residential schools. More than 1.5 lakh native children in Canada attended the residential schools from the 1800s until the 1990s as part of a government policy of forced assimilation. Many of the children were subjected to abuse, rape and malnutrition at the schools.

368.title: EAM defends buying Russian oil at event with UK minister, says 'most buyers in Europe'
368.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar defended India's decision to buy Russian oil at discounted rates in the presence of UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss. He said that in March (after Ukraine's invasion started) Europe bought 15% more oil and gas from Russia than a month before. "If you look at major buyers of oil and gas from Russia....most...are in Europe", he added.

369.title: Our meeting happening in difficult int'l environment: Jaishankar to Lavrov
369.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar in a conversation with Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Friday said that they are meeting "in a difficult international environment". Lavrov landed in India on Thursday, his first visit since Russia invaded Ukraine. Meanwhile, Lavrov said Indo-Russia ties are very sustainable. "We are interested in having a balanced world order," Lavrov stated.

370.title: He clearly hasn't learnt anything: Sunil Gavaskar on CSK's Shivam Dube
370.article_body: Reacting to all-rounder Shivam Dube conceding 25 runs in the 19th over against LSG in CSK's second straight defeat in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said, "He clearly hasn’t learnt anything." Gavaskar added, "He has played a fair bit of limited-overs cricket and he is still bowling those length balls. He is going to get punished."

371.title: Future of KKR is bright under Shreyas' captaincy: Irfan Pathan
371.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said that two-time IPL champions KKR's future is bright under Shreyas Iyer's captaincy, adding the glimpses of which were seen in the first couple of matches in IPL 2022. "He is...players' captain. He backs the players at every turn, which is a good sign of a leader," Irfan added. KKR will face PBKS today.

372.title: Viewing deck at Mumbai's Girgaum Chowpatty 'illegal': BJP's Rane
372.article_body: The ₹2.5 crore viewing deck, being constructed on a stormwater drain at the BR Tambe Square over the Girgaum Chowpatty in Mumbai, has been called "illegal" by the opposition. BJP leader Nitesh Rane, in a letter to BMC, alleged that pillars were erected in the sea without permission under CRZ norms, adding that "it...effectively damaged the ecosystem in the sea."

373.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa centre busted at Ghaziabad mall
373.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa centre at Mahagun mall located in Vaishali. Police said they'd received an obscene video of the spa centre, following which they raided the centre and arrested nine people on Friday. The arrested persons include four women and the manager of the spa centre.

374.title: Why shouldn't I buy if there's a discount?: FM on India buying Russian oil
374.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at a CNBC-TV18 event said that India has already started buying oil from Russia and has bought at least 3-4 days of supply. She asked, "Why shouldn't I buy (oil) if supply is available at a discounted rate?" She added, "I would put my country's national interest and energy security first."

375.title: Beautiful that narratives are built around it: Ashwin on 2019 incident with Buttler
375.article_body: On being asked about his first interaction with Jos Buttler at RR, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "He said 'Hi', I said 'Hi' again and we ended up having a very good chat about the state of cricket around the world." "It's beautiful and cute...that narratives are built around incidents like this," he added, referring to 2019 run-out incident with Buttler.

376.title: Tamil Nadu CM visits Delhi govt schools & mohalla clinics with Kejriwal
376.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin visited Delhi government schools and mohalla clinics with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday. "They were amazed by the school and all the facilities that we have," the headmistress of one school said. Stalin said his government will establish a world-class government model school in Chennai and he has invited Kejriwal in advance.

377.title: IAF's Suryakiran to hold fly-past over Hyderabad tomorrow
377.article_body: The Indian Air Force's Suryakiran Aerobatic Team, which will be conducting a fly-past over Hyderabad on April 2, has invited people to participate in a competition for the best picture taken during the event. "Shutterbugs prepare...Online competition is on... the best-tagged photo over the city wins...personalised hamper," the team tweeted along with the route and timings of the flypast.

378.title: Google unfairly blocked rival payment apps on Play Store, CCI reportedly finds
378.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that Google's billing system for app developers is "unfair and discriminatory", Bloomberg reported. "Google's conduct is also resulting in denial of market access to competing UPI apps," the CCI said in its preliminary report. This could lead to a situation where Google Pay's rivals are excluded from market in long run, it added.

379.title: 9 doctors of Navi Mumbai hospital injured after lift falls suddenly
379.article_body: As many as nine doctors of Amale Hospital in New Panvel in Navi Mumbai were injured after the lift fell down suddenly into the shaft after reaching the second floor. "The impact of the fall was high and doctors received injuries and they were admitted to different hospitals. All of them are out of danger," a fire department official said.

380.title: India can support process of mediation between Russia & Ukraine: Lavrov
380.article_body: Speaking about the possibility of India mediating between Russia and Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov on Friday called India an "important country". "If India seeks to play that role which provides resolution of the problem...If India is with its position of a just and rational approach to international problems, it can support such a process," said Lavrov.

381.title: Sale of non-vegetarian food banned in Pune's Dehu: Report
381.article_body: The civic body of Dehu in Pune, where the Marathi saint-poet Tukaram lived, has banned the sale of non-vegetarian food like meat and fish, PTI reported. Dehu Nagar Panchayat's chief officer Prashant Jadhav said, "The decision has been taken considering the sentiments of...locals and...devotees of Sant Tukaram." He said a flying squad has been formed to monitor the ban's implementation.

382.title: He's a champion: Malinga on Bravo becoming leading wicket-taker in IPL
382.article_body: After CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo (171) overtook Lasith Malinga (170) as the leading wicket-taker in IPL's history, the ex-Sri Lanka pacer and RR fast-bowling coach said, "Bravo is a champion." He tweeted, "More to go young man!" The 38-year-old achieved this feat against LSG at Brabourne Stadium on Thursday. Bravo has taken 171 wickets in 153 matches so far.

383.title: 'The Kashmir Files' no longer a film, it's a movement: Karan Johar
383.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has stated that Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' is no longer a film, it's a movement. The filmmaker added that the film is probably going to be cost-to-profit the biggest hit in Indian cinema. "You have got to acknowledge there is something that is connecting with this nation and academically you have to watch it," Karan stated.

384.title: 30-35 yrs of rivalry with Ram Charan turned to friendship: Jr NTR
384.article_body: Actor Jr NTR in an interview has stated that over 30-35 years of rivalry between himself and actor Ram Charan has turned into friendship after SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. He further said that their rivalry is very positive. "The whole scenario has changed after 'RRR' and Ram Charan and I are best friends now," the actor added.

385.title: New video claims to show reaction of Will Smith's wife after he slapped Chris
385.article_body: A new video has surfaced on social media, claiming to show actor Will Smith's actress-wife Jada Pinkett Smith's reaction after her husband slapped comedian Chris Rock at the Oscars over a joke about her alopecia condition. In the video, Jada seems to laugh after Chris says, "Will Smith just smacked the s*** out of me."

386.title: I just wanted to be back alive: Pune woman on being stuck in Ukraine
386.article_body: Shivani Lonkar, a third-year student of medicine in Kyiv, last week returned from war-torn Ukraine to her house in Pune. Talking about being stuck in Ukraine, 20-year-old Lonkar said, "[I] just wanted to be back alive." Stating that her last days in Ukraine left her scarred, Lonkar said, "Even if a cracker [bursts outside], it...takes...back to those days and emotions."

387.title: Railway Division takes over maintenance of Pune railway station
387.article_body: The Railway Division has taken over the management and maintenance of the railway station in Pune city. This comes after contracts made with the Indian Railway Stations Development Corporation Limited (IRSDC) for the management and maintenance ended. Work "related to catering and food stalls will be handed over to IRCTC", a Railway Division spokesperson said.

388.title: I'm not that rich: CEO of world's largest crypto exchange on $74 billion net worth
388.article_body: After Fortune magazine featured world's largest crypto exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao on its cover, the billionaire wrote, "[I'm] really not that rich, but honoured to be featured on the cover." The magazine had mentioned that the 44-year-old's estimated net worth is $74 billion and that Bitcoin boom had made him as rich as Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg "virtually overnight".

389.title: Dialogue should resolve disputes: Jaishankar in meeting with Lavrov
389.article_body: External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar in a meeting with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov underlined that disputes should be resolved through dialogue and diplomacy. Lavrov's visit to India comes weeks after Russia invaded Ukraine. Jaishankar emphasised the importance of cessation of violence and spoke about respecting international law, the UN Charter and territorial integrity of states.

390.title: I don't want to take pressure with my next performance: Sharvari Wagh
390.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh while talking about her upcoming project, said, "I don't want to take any pressure with my next performance." "I don't think any creative process can be justified after taking pressure of what the end result is going to be like," she added. The actress made her debut with 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'.

391.title: Google gave $12 mn fine for blocking us on YouTube: Russian TV channel
391.article_body: Tsargrad TV, a channel owned by sanctioned Russian businessman Konstantin Malofeev, has said Google has paid $12 million fine over its failure to restore access to Tsargrad's YouTube account. In March, the channel said Google lost an appeal against a 2021 ruling that it pay a daily $1,203 fine for blocking the account.

392.title: Netflix to relaunch 'Spy Kids', Robert Rodriguez to return as director
392.article_body: Netflix is all set to relaunch the 'Spy Kids' franchise. The streaming service has teamed up with Robert Rodriguez, the filmmaker who created the early 2000s family action-comedy movie series, to relaunch and reimagine the franchise for a new generation. The films featured Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino, Alexa PenaVega and Daryl Sabara.

393.title: Worried about Alia because she is too much too soon: Karan Johar
393.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar in a recent interview said he is worried about Alia Bhatt because she might have gotten 'too much too soon'. "Shah Rukh once said that...she will always have to be at the top of her game," Karan added. The filmmaker further said that he does not deserve any credit for Alia's achievements.

394.title: Delhi man threatens woman to kidnap her for rejecting his proposal; held
394.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly threatened a woman to kidnap her and to make her morphed pictures viral for rejecting his proposal, police said. Acting on the woman's complaint, police arrested him and found that he'd created multiple fake accounts on Instagram and had been stalking several accounts on the platform. Police have blocked five fake Instagram accounts belonging to him.

395.title: Kriti's sister Nupur to star in Ravi Teja's 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'
395.article_body: Kriti Sanon's sister Nupur Sanon has been roped in for Ravi Teja's first pan-India film, 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'. It is a biopic of Tiger Nageswara Rao, a thief of Stuartpuram in the 1970s. The film, which will be directed by Vamsee, will release in Telugu, Tamil, Kannada, Malayalam and Hindi. It'll be bankrolled by 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal.

396.title: Supermodel Bella Hadid to make acting debut with Hulu's 'Ramy'
396.article_body: Supermodel Bella Hadid is set to make her acting debut with Hulu's Emmy-nominated comedy series 'Ramy'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the 25-year-old model has been booked for a recurring guest star role on the forthcoming third season of the show. Created by and starring Ramy Youssef, the show is reportedly loosely based on his life.

397.title: Over 24 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
397.article_body: More than 24 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since the war began, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Friday. Around 23,000 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Thursday, it added. Numbers crossing the border have fallen significantly, with Thursday seeing the third-lowest number of crossings since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

398.title: Fan runs towards shirtless Messi, grabs him around neck to click selfie; video goes viral
398.article_body: A fan invaded the ground and ran towards shirtless Lionel Messi to click a selfie following Ecuador's 1-1 draw against Argentina. The fan took to his Instagram to share the selfie and a video. In the video, the fan can be seen grabbing Messi around the neck for taking a picture before the security personnel intervened.

399.title: Ukraine to receive super-modern equipment to protect skies: Envoy
399.article_body: Ukraine's ambassador to Japan, Sergiy Korsunsky, said Ukraine will soon be able to better protect its skies and cities from Russian attacks because it expects to receive "super-modern" equipment from US and Britain. "When they [Russia] fire cruise missiles from long distance, we cannot get to...launch place. We've to intercept them. That's why we need this modern equipment," Korsunsky added.

400.title: Manik Saha becomes BJP's first-ever Rajya Sabha MP from Tripura
400.article_body: Tripura BJP President Manik Saha was elected to the Rajya Sabha on Friday, making him the party's first-ever member in the Upper House of the Parliament from the state of Tripura. The dental surgeon-turned politician defeated his nearest rival CPI(M)’s Bhanulal Saha by 25 votes. Manik got 40 votes in his favour, 33 of which came from the BJP itself.
